title: data-vis disproportionality
description: Disproportion between data and mapping channel size.

title: 3d effect
description: 3D perspective leads to inaccurate perception due to near-far effect.

title: truncated axis
description: Disrupted data proportion caused by truncated axes.

title: double encoding
description: For instance, mapping the same data to both length and width, causing a doubled effect.

title: artistic manipulation of data marks
description: Artistic treatment of data labels, like gradients, shadows, decorations, etc.

title: wrong math computaion
description: Mathematical issues, such as parts of a pie chart not summing up to 100%.

title: pop-out effect on data mark
description: Artificially magnified data labels.

title: confound area with diameter
description: Mapping data to radius instead of area when using circular visualization.

title: wrong annotation/label
description: For example, portraying an upward trend with a downward arrow.

title: wrong label placement
description: Misplaced location of certain points, like incorrect geographical markers.

title: legend-vis inconsistency
description: Mismatch between legend palette and actual colors on the chart.

title: reverse axis
description: Transformation of line chart direction from right-to-left reading.

title: misleading decoration
description: Misleading interpretation of data growth, e.g., 10% growth visually resembling 100%.

title: vis-text disconnection
description: Detached text next to visualization from content inside the chart.

title: conclusion unsupported by data
description: Inconclusive conclusions in titles not supported by data.

title: unclear texts - typo，grammatical error
description: Spelling mistakes, sentence incoherence, etc.

title: vis itself as decoration
description: Visualization devoid of data encoding, serving as decoration only.

title: meaningless/confounding encoding
description: Excessive or non-functional encoding causing confusion.

title: invasion of figurative semantics
description: Use of pictorial symbols, readers interpreting semantics, often in isotypes and maps.

title: ambiguous encoding/mixed use of channels
description: Unclear encoding, uncertainty about the encoded channel.

title: unclear affordance for comparison
description: Unclear standards or benchmarks for data understanding and comparison.

title: lack of explanation for units/metrics
description: Lack of explanation for data metrics/how they were derived; e.g., claiming 100% speed without context.

title: data marks covered by decoration
description: Data obstructed by decorations or embellishments.

title: ghost elements / elements that represents nothing
description: Inclusion of chart elements without representing any meaningful data.

title: misleading highlight/visual cues
description: Highlighting text background, mistaken as a bar chart.

title: label that lacks callout
description: Unaccompanied data labels, lacking connecting lines.

title: vis as a joke
description: Violating data science standards, used for humorous graphics.

title: wrong vis of part-to-whole relationship
description: Visualization implying part-whole relationship when none exists, e.g., pie charts, 100% stacked bars.

title: wrong vis of logic - intersection/union
description: Visualization implying logical relationships (intersection, union) that data doesn't have, e.g., Venn diagrams.

title: fail to show uncertainty
description: Handling uncertain data, like a value range or inequalities.

title: unordered ordinal data/ordered non-ordinal data
description: Sorting ordered variables incorrectly, mis-sorting what shouldn't be sorted.

title: continuous encoding for categorical data
description: Connecting categories with lines unnecessarily.

title: fail to show 0/infinite/null
description: E.g., representing 0 and infinity.

title: categorical encoding for continuous data
description: E.g., using continuous data for choropleth maps.

title: wrong vis of add-on relationship
description: Visualization implying stacking relationship when data isn't stacked.

title: wrong vis of sequence
description: Visualization implying temporal relationship when none exists, e.g., funnel charts.

title: wrong vis of hierachical relationship
description: Visualization implying hierarchical relationship when none exists, e.g., tree maps.

title: multiple scales
description: Comparing data using disparate scales.

title: not aligned
description: Misalignment of graphic elements, not on the same baseline.

title: uneven data grouping/aggregation
description: Inconsistent data aggregation/grouping methods between visualizations.

title: uneven axis interval
description: Inconsistent spacing between axis tick marks.

title: comparing apples with oranges
description: Comparing entirely different entities.

title: overlapping data marks
description: Overlapping data points causing visual obstruction.

title: text rotation
description: Text not horizontally oriented, requiring head rotation to read.

title: small size
description: Small font size for titles, annotations, labels; challenging to read or distinguish.

title: cluttered label lines
description: Entangled annotation lines, making it hard to identify targets.

title: indistinguishable encodings
description: Using nearly identical colors, shapes, textures to encode different data.

title: Low_foreground-background contrast
description: Lack of contrast between foreground-background, foreground not prominent, hard to read.

title: colorblind inaccessible
description: Color palettes not considering color blindness/deficiency.

title: out of boundary
description: Visualization exceeding canvas boundaries, incomplete.

title: glitches
description: Missing pixels, often due to image export errors.

title: irregular segmentation/shaping
description: Using non-geometric shapes to map data, hindering data comparison.

title: same object，different encodings/different object，same encodings
description: Different colors for the same category/different categories with the same color.

title: rainbow colormap
description: Lack of intuitive representation of data differences.

title: dual axes
description: Usage of two different axes in a single chart.

title: unstructured layout
description: Disorderly layout, lacking clear reading sequence.

title: breaking the rule of proximity
description: Proximity of unrelated elements, distance between related elements.

title: same data structure，different channels
description: Same data structure using different mapping channels, e.g., using both bars and circles for the same value.

title: large number of units
description: Using icons to represent data points, inefficient for numerous icons.

title: lack of labels
description: Uncertainty about the values of each category.

title: lack of scale
description: E.g., missing axes, unable to determine scale.

title: lack of legend
description: Uncertainty about what each category/channel represents.

title: unclear signs/arrows
description: Unclear meanings of symbols like arrows, lines, often in illustrative graphics.

title: too many categories
description: Excessive shapes, colors, etc., generally avoid exceeding 7.

title: too many visual channels
description: Mapping more than 5 dimensions in a single visualization.

title: no need to vis (one value)
description: E.g., single value without meaningful visualization.

title: high information density
description: Overcrowded layout, lack of whitespace.

title: semantically mismatch
description: E.g., disregarding psychological impressions like coffee being brown, McDonald's being yellow.

title: stretched imagery
description: Image stretching causing distortion, often in cartograms, isotypes.

title: anti-mental-model
description: E.g., using a downward arrow to convey positivity.

title: cut-off imagery
description: Abrupt truncation of images, often in isotypes.

title: unconventional analogy of data scales
description: Using less understandable scale when explaining data scale.

title: uncomfortable pattern/imagery
description: Images invoking fear, horror, etc.

title: deliberate encoding to satisfy rhetorical intent
description: Centering a story on the United States, using color to highlight severity.

title: arrogant textual expression
description: E.g., using aggressive data interpretations in titles.
